metadata.name: Total Knee Replacement (Total Knee Arthroplasty)
metadata.typical_age_group: 50-75 years, but age alone not determining factor

red_flags.explanation: Standard recovery allows discharge by day 5-7
red_flags.action: Request documentation of specific complication requiring extended stay

standard_knee_implant.note: Price regulated but hospital markups vary

primary_indications.indication: Severe osteoarthritis with failed conservative management
clinical_criteria: Documented trial of conservative therapy for ≥3-6 months
Severe pain limiting ADLs (walking, stairs, sleep)
Chronic knee inflammation or significant deformity
documentation_must_include: X-ray report showing Grade 3-4 degeneration with joint space narrowing
Record of conservative therapy: NSAIDs, physiotherapy, lifestyle modifications for 3-6 months
Functional assessment: walking distance limitation, stair climbing difficulty
Pain score and impact on quality of life

insufficient_justifications.scenario: Mild to moderate OA without conservative trial
insufficient_justifications.typical_presentation: Kellgren-Lawrence Grade 2, some pain, no documented conservative therapy
insufficient_justifications.why_inadequate: Surgery premature; conservative management should be attempted for 3-6 months minimum
insufficient_justifications.insurer_likely_response: Reject; require documented trial of non-surgical treatment

insufficient_justifications.typical_presentation: Severe pain complaints but X-ray shows only Grade 2 changes
insufficient_justifications.why_inadequate: Grade 3-4 radiographic changes required for medical necessity
insufficient_justifications.insurer_likely_response: Reject; X-ray evidence doesn't support surgical intervention

essential_elements.example: Kellgren-Lawrence Grade 4: Severe joint space narrowing, large osteophytes, marked sclerosis
essential_elements.weak_if: X-ray report without specific KL grading or shows only Grade 1-2

essential_elements.format: Detailed record of 3-6 month trial with specific treatments
essential_elements.example: Failed 6-month trial: NSAIDs (Ibuprofen 400mg TDS x 3mo), physiotherapy (12 sessions), weight loss attempted (5kg lost), intra-articular steroid injection x2 - persistent Grade 8/10 pain
essential_elements.weak_if: No documentation of conservative therapy or duration <3 months

mandatory_preoperative.documentation: Radiologist report with KL grading, joint space measurement
mandatory_preoperative.red_flag_if_missing: Cannot confirm radiographic severity for surgical indication

mandatory_preoperative.when_required: All patients >40 years or cardiac history

unnecessary_tests.why_unnecessary: X-ray sufficient for OA diagnosis; MRI only for suspected ligament/meniscus injury
unnecessary_tests.exception: Complex cases, suspected tumor, revision planning

cost_inflation_schemes.pattern: Lack of medical necessity - premature surgery
cost_inflation_schemes.how_detected: Check for documented 3-6 month conservative trial and KL Grade
red_flag_indicators: No evidence of conservative therapy trial
Surgery performed without failed non-surgical management
cost_inflation_schemes.action: Reject claim; require evidence of medical necessity per guidelines

cost_inflation_schemes.how_detected: Verify implant invoice and barcoded sticker against operative note
red_flag_indicators: Billing for high-flex/gender-specific/custom implant but using standard
Implant cost significantly above market rate
Sticker/invoice doesn't match billed implant model
cost_inflation_schemes.action: Cross-verify implant documentation; approve only documented implant cost

cost_inflation_schemes.how_detected: Check laterality consistency across all documents
red_flag_indicators: Diagnosis says right knee, consent says left knee
X-ray laterality doesn't match operative site
Discharge summary shows different knee than consent
cost_inflation_schemes.action: Reject claim entirely; report to medical board for negligence

waiting_periods.note: TKR subject to long waiting period as planned procedure for chronic condition

common_rejection_reasons: Radiographic evidence doesn't meet Grade 3-4 severity

contextual_notes_for_llm.medical_reasoning_guidance: TKR medical necessity has TWO mandatory components: (1) Radiographic Grade 3-4 OA on weight-bearing X-ray, AND (2) Failed 3-6 month conservative trial. Missing either component = reject claim. Don't approve based on patient pain alone.
contextual_notes_for_llm.regulatory_context: Johnson & Johnson faulty hip implant case revealed device regulation gaps in India. Validation system must verify implant model against approved database and price benchmarks. Substandard implants billed as premium is significant fraud risk.
